description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7loiv","text":"Expansion microscopy is a super-resolution imaging technique that uses expandable hydrogels to increase the physical distance between fluorophores from fixed cells on coverslips. By isotropically expanding samples, the traditional wavelength-limited confocal microscopy imaging techniques can be improved upon ~4X in resolution. Here we use expansion techniques developed previously by others to confocal image TMEM55B and RILPL1. See below for more details and prior methods.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3oevt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ikpl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2pck8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mtop","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8c9an","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Laporte MH, Klena N, Hamel V, Guichard P","can_edit":1,"date":"1643673600","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/s41592-021-01356-4","guid":"90EA18003F8E11EDA9F7F38FCEE2C17E","id":2025,"journal":"Nature methods","protocol_id":"0","title":"Visualizing the native cellular organization by coupling cryofixation with expansion microscopy (Cryo-ExM)."}},"1":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Truckenbrodt S, Sommer C, Rizzoli SO, Danzl JG","can_edit":1,"date":"1551398400","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1038/s41596-018-0117-3","guid":"9C5B52D03F8E11EDA9F7F38FCEE2C17E","id":2026,"journal":"Nature protocols","protocol_id":"0","title":"A practical guide to optimization in X10 expansion microscopy."}}}}

references.title: Visualizing the native cellular organization by coupling cryofixation with expansion microscopy (Cryo-ExM).

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Transfection of Myc-RILPL1 in LRRK2 R1441C MEF cells
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"12o4c","text":"Seed LRRK2 R1441C MEF cells at 50-60% confluency on 12 mm glass coverslips in a 24 well plate in   of complete DMEM (DMEM containing 10% FBS and 1% penicillin-streptomycin) 24 hours before transfection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":97,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f3b5l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"A1319A20402A11ED8F6CD1B613BE0728","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6qu7f","text":"Transfect cells with Myc-RILPL1 plasmid using FuGENE 6 transfection reagent (E2691) at a 3:1 (3 µl FuGENE:1µg plasmid) ratio according to manufacturer’s guidelines. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Expanding cells in gels
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8fqko","text":"Remove gels from the 1.5 mL tube and place them each into a 10 cm petri dish with enough DI water to completely cover the gel (~10mL). Incubate the gels twice for   per incubation on a gentle rotator at  , replacing the water each time. Perform a final incubation with fresh DI water   at   with gentle rotation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":163,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":203,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":284,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":289,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9cbjt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"EDD12160403A11ED89FBA547E66F3E59","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"F0CA1610403A11ED89FBA547E66F3E59","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"F96EC360403A11ED89FBA547E66F3E59","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"FDF70AA0403A11ED89FBA547E66F3E59","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

steps.section: Expanding cells in gels
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2pkpg","text":"The next day, gels should appear expanded. Incubate gels with enough PBS to completely cover the gel (~10mL) three times for   each time at   with gentle rotation. Gels should shrink significantly, but will not shrink back to their original size.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":125,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":140,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"78pps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"06567190403B11ED89FBA547E66F3E59","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"EFCEA570404211EDB10EA1A37F22EFDA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}
